page.title: 01FARR AND ITS PEOPLE
page.content: The settlement of Farr stretches along the B851 which leaves the A9 and leads to Fort Augustus. As it is only about 9 miles from Inverness it is becoming a popular place to live for those who work in town but do not like to live there.A new water supply is making it possible for landowners to sell building plots where there is no well or spring. Sixty six people live in this block. Eleven of them are children. The people can use the post office,the primary school,and the two churches when they wish. The minister of the Free Presbyterian Church lives in a manse opposite the church while the minister of the United Free Church on the B851 lives in Tomatin.The members of these churches have strict rules about keeping the Sabboth holy.
